p: The pH of the treatments was evaluated on days 0, 3, 7, 15, 30, and 60. The average pH of the milk used for the cheese production was equivalent to 6.75 on the 1 st day. On days 15 and 60 of storage, pH showed a decreasing trend, such that it reached to 4.98 and 4.74 in the control group. pH changes were significantly different in samples containing 400 and 800 IU/mL nisin and samples containing higher concentrations (10 12) of probiotics compared to the control at the end of the storage period.
